main.description: Repository event stream, aka Firehose endpoint. Outputs repo commits with diff data, and identity update events, for all repositories on the current server. See the atproto specifications for details around stream sequencing, repo versioning, CAR diff format, and more. Public and does not require auth; implemented by PDS and Relay.

cursor.description: The last known event seq number to backfill from.

errors.name: ConsumerTooSlow
errors.description: If the consumer of the stream can not keep up with events, and a backlog gets too large, the server will drop the connection.

commit.description: Represents an update of repository state. Note that empty commits are allowed, which include no repo data changes, but an update to rev and signature.

seq.description: The stream sequence number of this message.

tooBig.description: Indicates that this commit contained too many ops, or data size was too large. Consumers will need to make a separate request to get missing data.

repo.description: The repo this event comes from.

prev.description: DEPRECATED -- unused. WARNING -- nullable and optional; stick with optional to ensure golang interoperability.

rev.description: The rev of the emitted commit. Note that this information is also in the commit object included in blocks, unless this is a tooBig event.

since.description: The rev of the last emitted commit from this repo (if any).

blocks.description: CAR file containing relevant blocks, as a diff since the previous repo state.

items.description: List of repo mutation operations in this commit (eg, records created, updated, or deleted).
List of new blobs (by CID) referenced by records in this commit.

time.description: Timestamp of when this message was originally broadcast.

identity.description: Represents a change to an account's identity. Could be an updated handle, signing key, or pds hosting endpoint. Serves as a prod to all downstream services to refresh their identity cache.

handle.description: The current handle for the account, or 'handle.invalid' if validation fails. This field is optional, might have been validated or passed-through from an upstream source. Semantics and behaviors for PDS vs Relay may evolve in the future; see atproto specs for more details.

account.description: Represents a change to an account's status on a host (eg, PDS or Relay). The semantics of this event are that the status is at the host which emitted the event, not necessarily that at the currently active PDS. Eg, a Relay takedown would emit a takedown with active=false, even if the PDS is still active.

active.description: Indicates that the account has a repository which can be fetched from the host that emitted this event.

status.description: If active=false, this optional field indicates a reason for why the account is not active.

repoOp.description: A repo operation, ie a mutation of a single record.

cid.description: For creates and updates, the new record CID. For deletions, null.
